intro: Trichocoryne connata, commonly known as the Connate trichocoryne, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in shrubland or woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
